Funtion.Detail: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with DNA of a specific nucleotide composition, e.g. GC-rich DNA binding, or with a specific sequence motif or type of DNA e.g. promotor binding or rDNA binding.

Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a nucleotide, any compound consisting of a nucleoside that is esterified with (ortho)phosphate or an oligophosphate at any hydroxyl group on the ribose or deoxyribose.

Interacting selectively and non-covalently with a specific DNA sequence in order to modulate transcription. The transcription factor may or may not also interact selectively with a protein or macromolecular complex.
Funtion.Keyword: Sequence-specific DNA binding transcription factor activity

Funtion.Detail: Catalysis of the phosphorylation of a histidine residue in response to detection of an extracellular signal such as a chemical ligand or change in environment, to initiate a change in cell state or activity. The two-component sensor is a histidine kinase that autophosphorylates a histidine residue in its active site. The phosphate is then transferred to an aspartate residue in a downstream response regulator, to trigger a response.

PDB.PDB_Title: The light state structure of the blue-light photoreceptor Aureochrome1 LOV
PDB.PubMed_Title: Crystal structures of Aureochrome1 LOV suggest new design strategies for optogenetics.
PDB.Author: Mitra, D., et al.

PDB.PDB_Title: The dark structure of the blue-light photoreceptor Aureochrome1 LOV
PDB.PubMed_Title: Crystal structures of Aureochrome1 LOV suggest new design strategies for optogenetics.
PDB.Author: Mitra, D., et al.
